oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Becky Hobbs Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Becky Hobbs (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Becky Hobbs; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Becky Hobbs radio spot for her audiobiography -- (00:06) Hobbs radio spot introducing Biff Collie and the Music City Album Review -- (00:16) Hobbs radio spot for her audiobiography -- (00:26) Hobbs radio spot for her audiobiography -- (00:34) Hobbs radio spot congratulating the listener for her audiobiography -- (00:46) Hobbs radio spot declaring she reveals almost everything she knows -- (00:55) Hobbs radio spot for her audiobiography -- (01:02) Hobbs thirty-minute radio spot [incomplete] -- (01:09) Hobbs asks how long she had been doing radio spots -- (01:17) Hobbs thirty-minute radio spot for her audiobiography -- (01:27) Hobbs hour radio spot addressing Collie for her audiobiography -- (01:42) Hobbs return-from-commercial radio spot for her audiobiography -- (01:49) Hobbs ninety-minute radio spot for her audiobiography -- (02:00) Hobbs commercial-break radio spot fro her audiobiography -- (02:08) Hobbs radio spot for her audiobiography -- (02:16) Hobbs radio spot asking Collie for feedback -- (02:21) Hobbs goodbye radio spot -- (02:29) Hobbs and Collie radio spot joking about who Collie performs with -- (02:45) Hobbs tells about how she grew up in Bartlesville, Oklahoma and Hobbs reflects on how she, and her sister, would play piano when they were young -- (04:14) Hobbs reflects on being a part of a number of groups in junior high school, and Hobbs talks about performing for a Rouge's Five's show -- (05:00) Hobbs discusses how she would create her own costumes -- (05:16) Hobb's first girl group, The Four Faces of Eve, is reflected on -- (06:07) Hobbs reflects on the life of a Beth Morrison -- (06:32) Hobbs recalls the first songs she ever wrote with the all-girl band -- (07:48) Hobbs reflects on her dedication to music -- (09:05) Hobbs recalls working on Dance Party where she started performing with The Sir Prize Package -- (10:52) Collie asks Hobbs to reflect on her influences and Hobbs describes her country and rock influences -- (12:03) Hobbs describes her rockabilly tunes "I'm in the Mood for Love" and expresses her desire to record a great old country song -- (12:40) Hobbs describes going to Tulsa University and how she constantly would be locked out of her dorm -- (14:09) Hobbs describes how she left her all-girl band and joined Swamp Fox -- (15:11) Hobbs describes her southern rock career moving her in Los Angeles -- (15:42) Hobbs recalls signing with Al Gallico and how she visited Nashville to perform for Billy Sherrill -- (17:16) Hobbs reflects on her song "The More I Get (The More I Want)," as well as, "I Can't Say Goodbye to You" opening doors for Hobbs -- (18:03) Hobbs discusses that, while she lived in Los Angeles, she was infatuated with Nashville -- (19:05) Hobbs describes how she performed for wet t-shirt contests -- (19:49) Hobbs describes how she prospered with "I'll Be Your Audience" writer Helen Reddy, and Hobbs recalls her first country cut "Feedin' the Fire" -- (21:16) Collie has Hobbs reflect on Loretta Lynn and Hobbs also includes George Jones -- (21:59) Hobbs discusses George Jones inspiration for "Jones on the Jukebox" -- (22:24) Hobbs discusses Moe Bandy being at one of her concerts and how they had recorded "Let's Get Over Them Together" -- (23:17) Hobbs describes the difficulty in being able to record with Bandy -- (23:53) Hobbs tells of how her song, "You Are," was recorded by Earl Campbell and Emmylou Harris -- (24:15) Hobbs describes her desire for "I Want to Know You Before We Make Love" to be a single and how eventually Conway Twitty recorded it -- (25:00) Collie and Hobbs discuss when Hobbs would open for Conway -- (25:39) Hobbs recalls when she moved to Nashville after being overwhelmed in Los Angeles -- (26:45) Hobbs describes her last thoughts on Los Angeles -- (27:20) Hobbs first thoughts on moving to Nashville are revealed -- (29:09) Hobbs reflects meeting Bandy and having interest from EMI Records -- (29:40) Hobbs recalls a story of when a bartender put a man's feet on fire -- (31:17) Hobbs recalls a humorous time she met a fan -- (31:42) Collie introduces a word game, and Collie and Hobb's discuss Bobby Orman -- (32:36) Collie and Hobbs discuss a flattering article -- (33:50) Hobbs recaps the time when she had signed with EMI Records, and Hobb's reflects on the new president of EMI Records firing her -- (36:05) Hobbs tells of how she had to perform on stage for a chance at a MTM Records contract -- (37:39) Hobbs tells about the mental games affecting her personal growth -- (40:17) Hobbs and Collie joke about people's inability to read a map -- (42:10) Hobbs discusses working for Curb Records,"A Little Hunk of Heaven," and her difficulty with doubts -- (44:12) Hobbs says she would love to do the score for a movie -- (44:43) Hobbs describes playing at the her piano the most relaxing feeling, and Hobbs tells about a time performing with Twitty -- (45:35) Collie and Hobbs discuss how Hobbs would love to be stuck on an island with Willie Nelson -- (46:08) Hobbs laughs
